html:
Best Overall

Hero Cosmetics Mighty Patch

Cons

  • Thicker patch makes it more visible

The Mighty Patch from Hero Cosmetics is the OG pimple patch. It's transparent enough for daytime wear, and strong enough to stay put overnight. Each patch is formulated with medical-grade hydrocolloid to suck the gunk out of your pimple and slow growth over a few hours. It's so good, I've lost count of how many packs I've gone through.

Patches per pack: 36

Amazon rating: 4.6/5

Our expert says: “This is my favorite non-medicated patch. It is a simple hydrocolloid patch that works well without added ingredients. It's great for sensitive skin and is a little bit thicker of the patch so stays on throughout the day/night.”—Dr. Farhang

Best with Salicylic Acid

Bliss Clear Genius Blemish Patches

Cons

  • May not be best for sensitive skin

The Bliss Clear Genius Blemish Patches are Dr. Farhang's go-to. “I love that this patch has effective yet gentle active ingredients that target the acne two ways: treat and prevent,” she says. ”Salicylic acid helps absorb the excess oil that is clogging the pore, and tea tree oil is anti-inflammatory.” It's also formulated with zinc sulfate, aloe, and vitamin B5 to help calm, protect, and moisturize.

Patches per pack: 66

Amazon rating: 4.3/5

An Amazon reviewer says: “Love these! I’ve tried a bunch of different brands, and these are by far the best! They are thin, actually help to clear up the pimple, and stay on well!”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best with Microdarts

Rael Microcrystal Spot Cover

Pros

  • Treat the pimple's core

Cons

  • Less than 10 patches per pack

There's truly nothing worse than a painful under-the-skin blemish. That's why Rael created the Microcrystal Spot Cover—a patch affixed with microcrystal spikes that penetrate the pimple to deliver healing ingredients like succinic acid and hyaluronic acid into its core.

Patches per pack: 9

Amazon rating: 4.2/5

An ELLE editor says: “Not only do the Rael Microcrystal Spot Cover patches magically shrink my biggest breakouts, but they visibly speed up the healing process—bringing the whitehead to the surface sooner. Plus, they stay on so well.”—Emma Aerin Becker, associate beauty e-commerce writer

Best for Redness

Peace Out Acne Healing Dots

Cons

  • Thicker than other brands

The Peace Out Acne Healing Dots are the ultimate blemish multitasker. They use hydrocolloid to draw out impurities, along with salicylic acid, vitamin A, and aloe vera, to help reduce oil production and calm redness. The result is smaller, less inflamed, and completely pus-free pores.

Patches per pack: 20

Sephora rating: 4.2/5

A Sephora reviewer says: “Never have I experienced quicker and better results than with these acne dots! Especially with those pesky under the skin pimples...the pimples are flat and that patch is FULL in no time at all! It makes healing a breeze too!”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Visible

Starface Hydro-Star Pimple Patches

Cons

  • Don't stick super well

If Hailey Bieber says it's cool to put yellow stars on our pimples, then that’s exactly what we’ll do. Starface’s Hydro-Stars do the heavy lifting for you by drying out blemishes and speeding up healing time, all while concealing your acne with fun and playful patches.

Patches per pack: 32

Ulta rating: 4.8/5

An Ulta reviewer says: “There may be a wide variety of pimple patches, but my all-time favorites are the Hydro Stars! I simply love them, and I would buy them over and over again. I love their design, they look so pretty on my skin, and they really help heal my pimples.”

Best for Overnight

PanOxyl Overnight Spot Patches

Cons

  • Not as effective on under-the-skin blemishes

In need of an extra-powerful patch? Look no further than the PanOxyl Overnight Spot Patches, which take a more aggressive approach to treating acne. Dr. Farhang loves them for their star ingredient. “This patch is formulated with benzoyl peroxide to be used overnight, which kills acne-causing bacteria and unclogs pores,” she explains.

Patches per pack: 40

Amazon rating: 4.5/5

An ELLE editor says: “As an acne-prone girl, these pimple patches are my absolute favorite. They effectively bring every whitehead to the surface and fast. I also notice that my post-popped pimples heal so much faster thanks to the benzoyl peroxide inside.”—Emma Aerin Becker

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Size Options

Corsx Master Patch Set

Cons

  • Not as strong as other brands

Pimples come in all shapes and sizes. Whether you're dealing with a large cystic blemish or trying not to pick at a tiny zit, the Cosrx Master Patch Set has a dot for it. These hydrocolloid patches come in three sizes, with 90 in a pack to treat and conceal every kind of breakout.

Patches per pack: 90

Ulta rating: 4.2/5

An Ulta reviewer says: “I have tried so many brands of pimple patches, and this is the one brand that actually works! It speeds up healing time significantly, actually draws out so much fluid, and reduces redness significantly. I love the different sizes, they stick on the best, and are tough to get off because the seal they form is tight. Put one on before bed, and see a noticeable difference in the morning.”

Best for On the Go

Practical Alchemy Just In Case Bundle

Cons

  • Case only holds one sheet at a time

The Practical Alchemy Just In Case Bundle is a travel essential. It includes 57 ultra-thin patches in multiple sizes, and a sleek case with tabs to secure your patch sheets and a built-in mirror for easy, on-the-go application. Consider it your emergency fix—just throw it in your purse and you're prepared.

Patches per pack: 57

Practical Alchemy rating: 5/5

A Practical Alchemy reviewer says: “The best pimple patch I’ve ever used - and the chicest case for emergencies on the go!”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

When should you use a pimple patch?

According to Dr. Farhang, pimple patches should be applied as soon as you feel a blemish forming beneath the skin. “Definitely before popping it,” she advises, adding that the patch should go on freshly cleansed, dry skin.

However, if you just can't help yourself (I get it), you can still apply a patch to an already-popped pimple—though it's not ideal. “A non-medicated hydrocolloid patch can help absorb remaining fluid, protect the open skin, and reduce the chance of infection or scarring,” she says. “Once the patch turns opaque or white, that’s a sign it has absorbed fluid and it’s time to remove.”

Meet the Expert

Dr. Sheila Farhang is a board-certified dermatologist, double-fellowship trained cosmetic surgeon, and reconstructive Mohs micrographic based in Arizona.
